questions.question: Which of the following is a key concept within Cluster Setup (Domain 1)?
questions.explanation: Kubernetes Dashboard Security is a key concept in Cluster Setup. This domain covers topics essential for the Kubernetes CKS exam.

questions.question: A professional is tasked with use cis benchmark to review the security configuration of kubernetes components. What should be the first step?
options: Assess the current state and identify requirements
Document the findings in a report
questions.explanation: The first step in any cluster setup task is to assess the current state before implementing changes.

questions.question: Which concept in Cluster Setup is most closely related to properly set up ingress objects with security control?
questions.explanation: Properly set up Ingress objects with security control falls under the implementation and operations aspect of Cluster Setup.

questions.explanation: Service Account Secret Restrictions is a key concept in Cluster Hardening. This domain covers topics essential for the Kubernetes CKS exam.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when working with use pod security standards and admission controllers?
options: Following industry best practices and standards
Reducing the number of team members involved
questions.explanation: When working with use pod security standards and admission controllers, following industry best practices ensures consistent and reliable results.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of "Set up appropriate OS-level security domains" in Minimize Microservice Vulnerabilities?

To evaluate compliance with minimize microservice vulnerabilities standards
questions.explanation: Set up appropriate OS-level security domains is a key objective in Minimize Microservice Vulnerabilities. Understanding this concept is essential for the exam.
